results.title: Sleuth
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures International, Morton Gottlieb, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Milo Tindle (Michael Caine), a former hairdresser, finds himself invited to cocktails by renowned mystery writer, Andrew Wkye (Laurence Olivier). Wyke’s 16th century residence is a treasure trove of games paraphernalia - dart boards, chess sets, robots and mazes, and Tindle is about to join the accoutrements. When Wyke reveals that he knows about Milo’s involvement with his estranged wife, Marguerite (Margo Channing), he devises a ploy to avoid paying alimony - a ploy that involves Tindle robbing his lover so that Wyke can claim on the insurance money. A power struggle ensues between the younger, middle class rival and the blue blood, upper-class ageing mystery writer. This taut, 3 character film was nominated for 3 Academy awards and was Mankiewicz’s final film. Based on the stage play by Anthony Shaffer.

results.title: Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: American Zoetrope, Mandalay Pictures, Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin, Adam Schroeder and Tim Burton
results.brief_description: Washington Irving’s classic tale of Ichabod Crane and the Headless Horseman is given a few new twists in the hands of director Tim Burton. Ichabod Crane (Johnny Depp) is a New York City detective whose unorthodox techniques and penchant for gadgets makes him unpopular with his colleagues. He is sent to the remote town of Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of bizarre murders, in which a number of people have been found dead in the woods with their heads cut off. Crane refuses to believe the local legend that the ghost of a sadistic Hessian soldier rides through the woods on horseback, lopping off the heads of the unbelieving and is convinced there is a logical explanation. This disturbing tale of suspense, murder and mysticism also stars Christina Ricci, Miranda Richardson, Christopher Lee and Christopher Walken.

results.title: Sleepy heads
results.brief_description: Combines art work and narration with live action to show the kinds of places where animals sleep. Based on the text written by Aileen Fisher.

results.title: Sleepy haven
results.brief_description: ‘Sleepy Haven’ is a dreamy experimental film experience made up of home movie pieces and appropriated footage. It is a homoerotic journey full of bare-chested sailors awaking from sleep, images of ships, and boat interiors, and the human surface, all shot and manipulated in a way that seems to bring the film’s surface, as well as the sailor’s bodies, to life. Each appears to be entered and travelled through along the way in this erotic rumination on public and private lives.

results.title: Sleepwalkers
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Mark Victor, Michael Grais, Nabeel Zahid and Mick Garris
results.brief_description: Written directly for the screen by master of horror Stephen King. Brian Krause, best known for his role as white-lighter Leo on the television series “Charmed”, stars as Charles Brady, who along with his mother Mary (Alice Krige,) are ‘Sleepwalkers’, creatures similar to vampires and werewolves, a dying race who can only stay alive by feeding on the life force of a virgin. When Charles and his mother move to the small town of Travis, Indiana, Charles becomes attracted to Tanya Robertson (Madchen Amick), a girl in one of his classes at school. When Mary pleads with her son to bring the beautiful girl home so they may feed off her, he is unable to do so as he has fallen in love with her. During their first date together Charles tries to take things further than Tanya intends and to ward him off she stabs him with a corkscrew. Staggering home to his mother, Charles is nursed back to heath and the two plan their retaliation against the Robertson family. Features cameo appearances by Mark Hamill, John Landis, Tobe Hooper, Joe Dante, Clive Barker and Stephen King himself as a cemetery attendant.

results.title: Sleepless in Seattle
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Gary Foster and Nora Ephron
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as a recently widowed architect with a young son who moves to Seattle on the East Coast of America to escape the painful memories of his life with his wife. Meg Ryan is a recently engaged journalist who believes she has found the perfect man in her fiancee. Its Christmas, the silly season and Hanks young son has called a talk-back show to try and help his Dad move on with life. Ryan hears his conversation with the radio announcer who calls him Sleepless in Seattle. His words strike a chord in Ryan who begins to doubt if her comfortable life is really all she wants. Thus begins a story of chance and double-chance and of finding true love. This one of the most enchanting romantic comedies ever created.

results.title: Sleeping dogs
results.brief_description: Against the background of political turmoil a loner on the run is caught between the forces of a repressive government and guerillas in the resistance movement in this fast paced political thriller/action/buddy movie. Set in an imagined totalitarian future, the film and the book on which it was based foresaw some of the confrontations between authorities and protesters that marked the 1981 Springbok Rugby Tour of New Zealand. The debut feature for both director Roger Donaldson and actor Sam Neill, this film is recognised as marking the beginning of contemporary New Zealand cinema. Cast includes Sam Neill, Ian Mune, Warren Oates, Nevan Rowe and Donna Akersten. Based on the novel ‘Smith’s Dream’ by C.K. Stead. Reference: ‘New Zealand Film 1912-1996’ eds. Helen Martin and Sam Edwards. Oxford University Press, Auckland 1997.

results.title: Sleeping Beauty
results.brief_description: This production of the classic ballet, “Sleeping Beauty” is performed by the Australian Ballet. Performed live at The Victorian Arts Centre, October 9, 1984, this ballet in a prologue and three acts has the beautiful Christine Walsh dancing the role of Aurora with touches of tenderness and grace, and David Ashmole creating an outstanding Prince Florimund. Music is performed by The Elizabethan Melbourne Orchestra, conducted by Ritchie Hanna.

results.title: Sleeping beauty
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: Once upon a time, in a kingdom far away, a beautiful princess was born, destined by a terrible curse to be drawn into a spectacular adventure of unparalleled suspense and fantasy. Experience the joy and magic of this thrilling Disney classic. Features the voices of Mary Costa, Bill Shirley, Eleanor Audley, Verna Felton, Barbara Luddy, Bill Thompson.
